themes: Need for dedicated and subsidized rehearsal/performance spaces
Support for pop-up and mobile venues in neighborhoods
Barriers to equitable grant access for small organizations
Importance of operational support for emerging arts organizations
Professional development and mentorship for emerging artists and educators
Integration of arts with social services and community engagement
Support for grassroots, educational community festivals
key_phrases: subsidized or dedicated venues for rehearsals, workshops, and shows
Operating Support for Emerging Arts Orgs
paid mentorships, internships, and transitional support
barriers_identified: Lack of affordable or dedicated rehearsal/performance spaces
Difficulty accessing city funding due to complex grant applications
Insufficient operational support for emerging organizations
Limited professional development opportunities for artists and educators
Underserved neighborhoods lacking arts and social services integration
solutions_proposed: Offer subsidized or dedicated venues for rehearsals, workshops, and shows
Support for touring programs or temporary performance installations across neighborhoods
Provide workshops, grant writing help, and coaching for grant applications
Create operational support grants for emerging arts organizations
Develop paid mentorships, internships, and transitional support for young artists
Support credentialing or professional development for arts educators, especially in underserved schools
Lead initiatives integrating arts into health, housing, or youth services
Support grassroots festival models that focus on education and accessibility
